@kerstinsailer we want to help educate folks about how to perform qualitative and quantitative research. So many buzzwords without rigour.
@paulcarder @SaraBean2 @JoSutherlandPR @InsightOnWork it's called applied research & it's done by some WP profs (like us & @kerstinsailer😁)
Do you know what a Likert scale is? If you don't know, I can guarantee you've used it at some point. (Check it out!) https://t.co/kbFJVWV0YT

@dds180 that really bothered me!! Using suspension of disbelief I guessed she released him somehow...
@DrMel_T in the mix, yes. But less desirable in say our nations' politicians where narcissism is rife. 😉
@BarshaPanda @raju @BBCNews data shows women are still working more In aggregate but data also shows men's mental health needs attention.
@raju given that suicide is the #1 killer of men under 35 (in U.K.), we should seek amelioratives. Improved access to family time may be one
@raju this nugget: "employers need to ensure that work is designed in a way that helps women and men find a good work-life fit,"
Work-life balance 'increasingly stressful for fathers' https://t.co/r8EIqDO0F7
@DrMel_T but all ppl are shades of light & dark so I might say certain traits within personality mix can be helpful & narcissism could be 1
@DrMel_T certainly. And every heathy person has ego. But "narcissist" would assume it's the dominate quality, so I would still say no.
Really impressed with the ongoing coverage in @TeenVogue. Keep young women informed and active!! https://t.co/BhlWc1eIvI
